name: Hanoi Old Centre Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice little hotel. The location is fantastic, right next to the lake and smack in the old quarter. The hotel staff are the mostly friendly ppl I've ever met. Very helpful and will see to your every needs. The hotel rooms are ok with the price. Took the tour to Halong Bay and Sapa from the hotel, they'll be able to get you good prices.
reviews.title: Great hotel, impeccable service

reviews.text: Really a wonderful place to stay in Hanoi
reviews.title: Great little hotel with friendly atmosphere in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is perfectly placed in Old Quarter. Staff are friendly and very willing to help. Felt very much at home. Excellent coffee!
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel, great location - beautiful staff.

reviews.text: Great little hotel, in a perfect location, with everything you need. views of the lake in amongst the soul of hanoi and its old quarter. Staff are just wonderful.
reviews.title: Best location in th ols quarter - excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a HUGE, clean room on the 6th floor with a double and two singles, and a beatiful wiew over Hoan Kiem Lake. Friendly and helpful staff did their best to make us feel welcome (and succeeded:-). Location is the best in Hanoi old city, in my opinion, situated in a quiet, charming street two minutes from the heart of the old city.
reviews.title: it's a 5 stars hotel with 2 stars prize!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for four nights at the beginning of our north to south trip through Viet Nam. The location is really good – just a couple of minutes walk to Hoan Kiem Lake and a 10 minute stroll to the tourist restaurant strip and the famous Bia Hoi (“fresh beer”) corners for 25 cent pots of beer!! The room and bathroom were very small and dated, but clean and functional. The bed was small and hard. There was a flat screen TV mounted on the wall in front of the bed. There is a lift, free Wi-Fi in the rooms, and two computers for guest use in the lobby. The included breakfast, which was a la cart, was plentiful and offered reasonable choice.
reviews.title: Great location and helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of the room choice, we made the mistake of paying a couple of dollars (literally!) extra for a Deluxe Balcony room. This meant that we were right on the street – a very noisy situation in Hanoi!! We wished we’d taken the Superior Window room – identical, but not directly street-facing – or the Deluxe Lake View to avoid the very noisy traffic and horn-honking that is relentless from about 5.00am to midnight(ish). For the record, all hotels of this type and location in Hanoi would be subject to this same issue.
reviews.title: AMAZING STAFF, Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, had good English language skills and doubled as very efficient travel agents. Thuy was particularly helpful to us; she planned and booked our side trips to Halong Bay and Sapa without any dramas at all. The hotel is more than happy to store luggage for you, and offers the use of a shower when you’re in between such trips. They also (for $15 transfer fee) arranged for a staff member to meet us at the train at 4am upon our return from Sapa to ensure we made it to the airport for our 6.30am flight. This kind of service certainly takes the stress away from travelling on a tight schedule.
reviews.title: As charming as the cirty

reviews.text: For the service and location, I would stay here again. If you’re after comfort, though, maybe shop around....
reviews.title: Extremely helpful staff and very good location is the heart of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two general Hanoi tips: 1) Don’t arrange for a private tour on a Monday – many sights / museums are closed!! 2) Facebook is not directly available in Viet Nam. If you’re an avid FB user, you’ll need to download a program called ‘Ultrasurf’ on any computer that you’re using. This opens a new search engine, which allows you to search for FB and then allows you access. It’s very easy to do, and you can either save the program for future use, or it self-deletes when you close the program.
reviews.title: First class service
The best
reviews.text: The staff at Hanoi Old Centre are the definition of human kindness. They will go out of their way to help you with anything, and expect nothing in return. Easily the nicest hosts I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. On top of this, the rooms are extremely clean and quiet. The rooms pictures are 100% real. You will hear no motorbike horns. Book your Halong tour through them as well. Complimentary breakfast is an actual meal and will fill you up. Just an overall wonderful Hotel.

reviews.title: Clean hotel in great location with wonderful friendly staff
reviews.text: Couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough. Staff are really warm, friendly and welcoming. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Hotel is in a great location for exploring the old centre of Hanoi. The banana pancakes for breakfast are the tastiest in Vietnam! We came back to the hotel after trips to Sapa and Halong Bay and it really felt like a home away from home - thanks to all the lovely staff.

reviews.title: Home away from Home
reviews.text: - family/friendly oriented

reviews.title: Lovely quiet oasis in busy Hanoi with super friendly staff
reviews.text: - Going the Extra Mile for Service

reviews.title: Fantastic realy helpfull staff
reviews.text: - kind and generous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at the Hanoi Old Centre Hotel on our recent trip through SE Asia for 3 nights, arrived early in he morning on the first day where we were met with a smile at the reception, our hostess enquired about us and sorted out a tour whilst we waited for our room to be readied.
reviews.title: Amazing staff, excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was rather small and not very modern, could definitely do with updating, but like mentioned by others, the staff were absolutely amazing, and made us feel like we were part of the family. They go out of their way to help you out, answer all your questions and see to your every need, always with a smile and the occasional joke. Breakfast is provided as well, we enjoyed it every day and it definetely doesn't need any bacon, all you need it Pho!
reviews.title: Great hotel to stay in the center of Hanoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great, just around the corner from the French Quarter and the lake, couldn't be better, and it's pretty cheap as well, so an absolute bargain, even if the rooms are a little small and the facilities a bit outdated.
reviews.title: Its in the Old Center alright!

reviews.text: Also the laundry service is rather cheap so make the most of it whilst you're there!
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The airport transfer organized by the hotel is recommended.
reviews.title: Exactly as they say A home a way from home

description: Located in the centre of Hanoi Old Quarter, Hanoi Old Centre Hotel is in quiet and shady street at 19 HANG HANH Street, less than a minute to Hoan Kiem Lake. This area is served by Restaurants, Bars, Major Post Office, Banks, Local Night Market... Not only convenient for dining, shopping... especially for attractions, it's simple to walk to Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, The Temple of Literature, Ngoc Son Temple, Water Puppet Theater and Museums. HOC provide different types of room to suit your every need. All rooms are selectively equipped to confine fine bedding, well recognized, some rooms with Lake View, some rooms with City View, Window or Balcony and adequately equipment as Cable LCD TV, Minibar, Air-Conditioner, Fan, Electric Safe, Cupboard, Telephone, Internet access, Computer in lobby (Complimentary), Wifi Access, Work Desk, Sitting area, Hair-dryer, Slippers, Private bathroom with hot shower and Bathroom Amenities. Elevator serves all floors. Staff are well trained and all speak English, are friendly and enthusiastic about our work from recommending where to visit, to eat, to call you a taxi or arranging a tour or onward travel which are highly recommended by all previous Guests. * Complimentary breakfast and mineral water. * Wifi Access available in all rooms. * Internet computers are located in the lobby.Useful Information:
